# Medical Countermeasures Capacity Partnerships

BARDA’s commitment to investing in pharmaceutical manufacturing and supply
chain resilience  

;

BARDA Programs __

  * BARDA
  * __CBRN Programs __

    * Antivirals/Antitoxins

;

BARDA’s COVID-19

Domestic MCM Manufacturing Capacity Strengthening

MCM Manufacturing Capacity Strengthening

BARDA is making critical investments to accelerate the expansion of domestic
manufacturing capacity for ancillary supplies (e.g., needles, syringes, vials)
as part of our commitment to foster and expand domestic pharmaceutical
manufacturing.

Next Generation Manufacturing Investments

BARDA is making critical next-generation and continuous manufacturing
investments to drive innovation in manufacturing.

MCM Industrial Base Expansion

BARDA is investing in the domestic industrial base to sustain the
manufacturing capacity for raw materials, critical ingredients, consumables,
and facilities required to produce COVID-19 (and future) vaccines and
therapeutics.

This page is updated regularly, but may not include all awards

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Corning Incorporated (Corning Pharmaceutical Technologies) USA

**Product Name:** Corning glass tubing and bulk vials

* * *

**Description:**  
This award expands the domestic industrial base capacity of advanced, high-
quality Corning glass tubing as well as converted vials to reduce supply chain
risk and ensure rapid delivery of medical countermeasures (MCMs).

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** | $103,796,898.00 (September 13, 2022)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Gerresheimer Glass Inc. null

**Product Name:** Vials

* * *

**Description:**  
This effort proposes vial manufacturing capacity expansion of Gerresheimer
Glass’ existing facility to address the shortage of domestic vial
manufacturing capacity and to secure national defense requirements for
response to current and future pandemic threats.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** | $65,591,077.00 (August 3, 2022)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Croda USA

**Product Name:** Domestic capacity expansion of raw materials for lipid
nanoparticle technology

* * *

**Description:**  
Croda will expand existing plant capacity of lipids to support the domestic
manufacturing supply chain for the lipid nanoparticle technology used in mRNA
vaccine production.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** | $75,000,000 (June 17, 2022)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Jubilant HollisterStier LLC (JHS) USA

**Product Name:** Expansion of Aseptic Fill-Finish BSL-1 Capacity

* * *

**Description:**  
This award will double the company’s annual fill-finish capacity with the
addition of two Biosafety Level 1 (BSL-1) lines equipped with state-of-the-art
technology. The new lines will be high-speed commercial scale with multi-
product formulation, filling, and finishing capacity for the manufacture of
both vaccines and therapeutics, including packaging and cold storage.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** | $149,684,100  (May 27, 2022)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Evonik USA

**Product Name:** Domestic capacity expansion of raw materials for lipid
nanoparticle technology

* * *

**Description:**  
Evonik will expand domestic manufacturing capacity for critical lipids used in
mRNA vaccine production.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** | $149,100,000 (May 20, 2022)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### TriLink BioTechnologies USA

**Product Name:** Domestic expansion of nucleoside triphosphate (NTPs) &
capping reagent manufacturing

* * *

**Description:**  
TriLink will expand its manufacturing capacity of nucleoside triphosphate
(NTP) and capping reagents to support the domestic manufacturing supply chain
for mRNA vaccine production.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** | $38,819,837 (May 18, 2022)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Exela Pharma Sciences, LLC USA

**Product Name:** Expansion of Aseptic Fill-Finish BSL-1 Capacity

* * *

**Description:**  
This award will expand and accelerate the company’s existing domestic aseptic
formulation, fill and finish manufacturing capacity. Exela will design, build
and commission one Biosafety Level 1 (BSL-1) multi-product formulation,
filling and finishing operation for the manufacture of vaccine and therapeutic
products. ​

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** | $40,402,738  (May 5, 2022)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Stevanato Group (SG) dba OMPI of America, Inc. USA

**Product Name:** Vials

* * *

**Description:**  
This effort proposes new construction of a domestic glass vial facility and
represents the first U.S. location for this multinational vial producer.
Domestic real property expansion will increase vial manufacturing capacity for
bulk and ready-to-use vials to satisfy national defense purposes in response
to current and future pandemic threats.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** | $94,484,412.00 (February 28, 2022)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Schott Pharma USA, Inc. USA

**Product Name:** Vials

* * *

**Description:**  
This effort proposes vial manufacturing capacity expansion of Schott Pharma’s
existing facility to address the need shortage for domestic vial manufacturing
capacity and to secure national defense requirements for response to current
and future pandemic threats.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** | $42,491,087.00 (January 21, 2022)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### High Purity New England (HPNE) USA

**Product Name:** Single-Use Technology and Single-Use Systems

* * *

**Description:**  
HPNE will expand the manufacturing capacity of single-use assemblies, single
use pumps, 2D bags, and single-use mixing systems that are critical components
in vaccine manufacturing in support of the COVID-19 response. The newly
expanded capacity is expected to be online in early 2023.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** | $15,000,000.00 (January 6, 2022)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** No

  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Par Pharmaceutical, an Endo International company USA

**Product Name:** Expansion of Aseptic Fill-Finish BSL-2 Capacity

* * *

**Description:**  
This award establishes a new domestic sterile fill-finish manufacturing asset
capable of processing products requiring Biosafety Level 2 (BSL-2)
containment, including packaging and cold storage, and provides sterile fill-
finish manufacturing services to the U.S. government.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** | $89,998,664  (November 12, 2021)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Retractable Technologies, Inc USA

**Product Name:** Increasing U.S. Manufacturing Capacity of Essential
Healthcare Supplies

* * *

**Description:**  
The partnership between BARDA-JPEO and Retractable Technologies, Inc. supports
capacity expansion for the manufacturing of safety needles and syringes that
are necessary to support the American healthcare system during the COVID-19
pandemic

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** |  $53,664,286 (July 1, 2020)  
---|---  
**Mod/Option 1 Amount:** | $27,365,232.00 (May 13, 2021)  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Meissner Filtration Products USA

**Product Name:** Biocontainer, Freeze Thaw and Filling Assemblies, Fluid
Transfer and Filtration Sets

* * *

**Description:**  
Meissner will expand domestic capacity for single-use systems manufacturing
including biocontainer assemblies, bottle assemblies, fluid transfer sets,
filtration sets and filling assemblies that are critical components in vaccine
manufacturing in support of the COVID-19 response.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** | $13,392,790.00 (April 1, 2021)  
---|---  
  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Merck Sharp & Dohme Corp. USA

**Product Name:** Immediate Response COVID-19 Manufacturing Network

* * *

**Description:**  
Merck will repurpose some of its facilities in the U.S. to support rapid,
large-scale manufacturing of vaccines or therapeutics for use in public health
emergencies including the current pandemic. The facilities will be available
to produce Merck products against COVID-19 or to private sector partners
working with the federal government on the COVID-19 response, beginning with
the Johnson & Johnson vaccine.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** |  $105,400,000.00 (March 1, 2021)  
---|---  
  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### The Texas A&M University System USA

**Product Name:** Capacity Expansion and Reservation Contract for
TAMUS/Fujifilm

* * *

**Description:**  
Through this award, BARDA will reserve existing vaccine manufacturing capacity
as well as expand manufacturing capacity at the Texas A&M CIADM, via a
modification to an existing award to Fujifilm Diosynth Biotechnologies. This
investment is part of BARDA’s work to strengthen domestic capacity to produce
vaccines against COVID-19.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** |  264,693,063.00 (July 24, 2020)  
---|---  
**Mod/Option 1 Amount:** | $8,410,083.00 (November 24, 2020)  
  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Cytiva USA

**Product Name:** COVID-19 Vaccine Manufacturing

* * *

**Description:**  
Cytiva will expand its existing domestic Continental US (CONUS) based
manufacturing capacity for pharmaceutical consumables and hardware products
required in the manufacture of potential USG (BARDA and affiliated partners)
COVID-19 vaccines

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** |  $31,190,000 (October 13, 2020)  
---|---  
  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Ology Bioservices, Inc. USA

**Product Name:** Reservation of SARS-COV-2 Fill and Finish Manufacturing
Capacity

* * *

**Description:**  
This action will reserve production capacity for a total of approximately
15.57 M vials to satisfy an urgent need for reserve domestic aseptic fill /
finish manufacturing capacity for critical vaccines and therapeutics that are
being developed in response to COVID-19. It will help ensure an uninterrupted
supply throughout the COVID-19 campaign.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** |  $106,300,002.00 (August 17, 2020)  
---|---  
  

X

#### Next Generation Manufacturing Investment

__

### Grand River Aseptic Manufacturing, Inc. (“GRAM”) USA

**Product Name:** Manufacture & Distribution of COVID-19 Vaccines/Therapeutics

* * *

**Description:**  
Expansion of Grand River Aseptic Manufacturing (“GRAM”)’s domestic capacity to
perform aseptic fill/finish services for a USG-selected COVID-19 vaccine(s) or
therapeutic products.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** |  $1,600,000.00 (August 6, 2020)  
---|---  
  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### ICU Medical USA

**Product Name:** Expanding Domestic Production of Needles & Syringes

* * *

**Description:**  
The partnership between BARDA-JPEO and ICU Medical supports capacity expansion
for the manufacturing of safety needles and syringes that are necessary to
support the American healthcare system during the COVID-19 pandemic.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** |  $20,663,774 (July 11, 2020)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Becton, Dickinson and Company USA USA

**Product Name:** Expanding Domestic Production of Needles & Syringes

* * *

**Description:**  
The partnership between BARDA-JPEO and Becton, Dickinson supports capacity
expansion for the manufacturing of safety needles and syringes that are
necessary to support the American healthcare system during the COVID-19
pandemic and for other public health emergencies.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** |  $42,303,230 (July 1, 2020)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### Next Generation Manufacturing Investment

__

### Colorado State University USA

**Product Name:** SolaVAX™ is an inactivated virus vaccine platform

* * *

**Description:**  
Riboflavin & UV light selectively inactivate virus particles by directed
damage to nucleic acids while preserving the integrity of proteins & viral
antigens. Generated virus particles will contain all potential antigenic
targets for immune response for use in a vaccine without capacity for
replication post-infection.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** |  $699,994 (June 23, 2020)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Corning Pharmaceutical Technologies, Corning Incorporated USA

**Product Name:** Corning glass tubing, vials, and cartridges

* * *

**Description:**  
To expand the domestic industrial base capacity of advanced, high-quality
Corning glass borosilicate tubing as well as domestic conversion of vials to
reduce supply chain risk and ensure rapid delivery of medical countermeasures
(MCMs).

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** | $261,623,543.00 (June 5, 2020)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### Next Generation Manufacturing Investment

__

### Snapdragon Chemistry Inc. USA

**Product Name:** Continuous Manufacturing for Ribonucleotide Triphosphates

* * *

**Description:**  
Rapidly scalable continuous manufacturing platform for the chemical synthesis
and purification of ribonucleotide triphosphates (NPT) from shelf-stable
ribonucleotide.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** |  $691,878 (May 29, 2020)  
---|---  
  

**Cost Share:** Yes

  

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### CIADM at Emergent Biosolutions USA

**Product Name:** CDMO Drug Substance and Drug Product Manufacturing Capacity
and Expansion

* * *

**Description:**  
Emergent BioSolutions will commit drug substance and drug product
manufacturing capacity valued at approximately $542.75 million for production
of COVID-19 vaccine candidates through 2021, in addition to an investment of
approximately $85.5 million for the rapid expansion of Emergent’s contract
development and manufacturing (CDMO) viral and non-viral drug product / fill-
finish capacity for vaccines and therapeutics.

  

**Unique Impact:**  
Emergent BioSolutions will commit drug substance and drug product
manufacturing capacity valued at approximately $542.75 million for production
of COVID-19 vaccine candidates through 2021, in addition to an investment of
approximately $85.5 million for the rapid expansion of Emergent’s contract
development and manufacturing (CDMO) viral and non-viral drug product / fill-
finish capacity for vaccines and therapeutics.

  

* * *

**Task Order:** |  $628,250,000 (May 30, 2020)  
---|---  
**Task Order:** | $20,000,000.00 (August 6, 2020)  
**Task Order:** | $22,815,445.00 (March 24, 2021)  
  

Product no longer supported

X

#### MCM Industrial Base Expansion

__

### Phlow USA

**Product Name:** US Based Advanced Manufacturing for COVID-19 essential
medicines and future threats

* * *

**Description:**  
Phlow pursues their mission of securing the national supply of essential
medicines through partnerships with pharmaceutical supply and manufacturing
organizations including AMPAC Fine Chemicals, Civica Rx, and the Medicines for
All Institute at the Virginia Commonwealth University’s College of
Engineering.

  

**Unique Impact:**  
Phlow pursues their mission of securing the national supply of essential
medicines through partnerships with pharmaceutical supply and manufacturing
organizations including AMPAC Fine Chemicals, Civica Rx, and the Medicines for
All Institute at the Virginia Commonwealth University’s College of
Engineering.

  

* * *

**Base Award Amount:** |  $360,284,721.00 (May 18, 2020)  
---|---  
  

Product no longer supported
